scope: Full-year financial statement audit for FY 2023/24 including revenue, fixed assets, capital projects and regulatory compliance disclosures
executiveSummary: Unqualified audit opinion issued for ZESCO FY 2023/24 financial statements. Two medium-severity findings noted relating to revenue recognition timing and fixed asset register maintenance.

findings.title: Revenue Recognition Timing Variance
findings.description: Prepaid electricity token revenue was recorded in the period of sale rather than consumption period, resulting in a ZMW 45,000,000 overstatement of Q2 2024 revenue.
findings.recommendation: Implement automated revenue recognition module aligned to IFRS 15 consumption-based recognition criteria.
findings.managementResponse: System upgrade planned for Q2 2025. Manual adjustment processes implemented as interim measure.
findings.actionTaken: Manual reconciliation process implemented. Revenue restated in Q3 2024 management accounts.

findings.title: Fixed Asset Register Discrepancies
findings.description: Physical verification identified 127 assets not captured in the fixed asset register with an estimated value of ZMW 18,500,000.
findings.recommendation: Conduct full physical asset verification and update FAR. Implement periodic physical verification policy covering all depots and substations.
findings.managementResponse: Full physical asset count conducted Q3 2024. FAR updated accordingly. Policy document issued.
findings.actionTaken: Full physical verification completed. 127 assets added to FAR. Annual verification policy issued and approved by Board.

scope: IT systems security review covering network infrastructure, access management, SCADA security and data centre controls
executiveSummary: IT audit identified three findings across access management and SCADA cyber controls. No critical vulnerabilities found. Overall IT control environment rated satisfactory with areas for improvement.

findings.title: Privileged Access Management Weaknesses
findings.description: 17 former employees retained active system administrator credentials in the SCADA control platform up to 90 days after separation from employment.
findings.recommendation: Implement automated account deprovisioning linked to HR separation workflow within 24 hours of employee exit.
findings.managementResponse: IT and HR workflows integrated. Automated deprovisioning deployed November 2024.
findings.actionTaken: All orphaned accounts removed. Automated HR-IT integration implemented. Policy updated.

findings.title: SCADA Network Segmentation Gap
findings.description: SCADA operational technology network shares three network segments with the corporate IT network, creating a potential lateral movement risk for cyber threats.
findings.recommendation: Implement full air-gap or strict firewall segmentation between OT and IT networks per IEC 62443 industrial cybersecurity standard.
findings.managementResponse: Network segmentation project initiated. Estimated completion Q2 2025.
findings.actionTaken: Interim firewall rules deployed. Full segmentation design completed and procurement underway.

findings.title: Patch Management Backlog
findings.description: 42% of server operating systems were running OS versions more than 24 months behind current security patch level, exposing systems to known vulnerabilities.
findings.recommendation: Establish a monthly patch management cycle with automated deployment for critical security patches within 72 hours of vendor release.
findings.managementResponse: Patch management policy updated. Critical patches applied. Full remediation Q1 2025.
findings.actionTaken: Critical and high-severity patches applied to all servers. Monthly patch schedule established.

scope: Environmental compliance audit of ZESCO generation stations and transmission depots against ZEMA environmental management plan conditions
executiveSummary: Environmental audit identified three findings including transformer oil spill containment deficiencies and inadequate effluent management at Kafue Gorge station. ZEMA notified. Corrective action plans submitted.

findings.title: Transformer Oil Spill Containment Non-Compliance
findings.description: Containment bunds at 6 of 14 major substations do not meet ZEMA-required 110% oil volume retention capacity, creating soil and groundwater contamination risk.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade substation oil containment bunds to meet 110% retention standard. Implement quarterly bund integrity inspections.
findings.managementResponse: Bund upgrade works completed at all 6 substations by December 2023.
findings.responsiblePerson: Head of Health, Safety and Environment
findings.actionTaken: Containment bunds upgraded at 6 substations. ZEMA inspection verified compliance December 2023.

findings.title: Effluent Discharge Monitoring Gap - Kafue Gorge
findings.description: Monthly effluent quality monitoring reports for the Kafue Gorge station discharge point had not been submitted to ZEMA for 8 consecutive months, a breach of EIA conditions.
findings.recommendation: Reinstate monthly effluent monitoring programme. Appoint dedicated environmental monitoring officer at Kafue Gorge station.
findings.managementResponse: Monitoring officer appointed. ZEMA reporting reinstated from October 2023.
findings.actionTaken: Environmental monitoring officer appointed. ZEMA monthly reports filed retrospectively and on schedule from October 2023.

findings.title: Hazardous Waste Manifest Incomplete Records
findings.description: Waste disposal manifests for PCB-contaminated transformer oils were incomplete for 23 disposal events, making full chain-of-custody traceability impossible.
findings.recommendation: Implement electronic waste manifest system with full chain-of-custody capture from generation to final disposal.
findings.managementResponse: Electronic manifest system procured and deployed Q1 2024.
findings.responsiblePerson: Head of Health, Safety and Environment
findings.actionTaken: Electronic hazardous waste manifest system deployed. Historical records reconstructed. ZEMA briefed.

scope: ERB regulatory compliance inspection covering tariff application, metering accuracy, service quality standards and consumer complaint resolution
executiveSummary: ERB inspection found ZESCO broadly compliant with licence conditions. Two minor findings relating to complaint resolution timeliness and meter accuracy records. No financial penalties imposed.

findings.title: Customer Complaint Resolution Timeliness
findings.description: 23% of logged customer complaints were not resolved within the ERB-mandated 30-day period. Average resolution time was 42 days for the review period.
findings.recommendation: Implement automated complaint escalation workflows to ensure timely resolution and ERB reporting compliance.
findings.managementResponse: Customer care system upgraded with automated escalation alerts. Team KPIs revised.
findings.actionTaken: CRM system upgraded. Resolution time reduced to average 18 days by August 2024.

findings.title: Meter Accuracy Calibration Records Incomplete
findings.description: Calibration certificates for 340 revenue meters could not be produced during inspection, representing 8% of sampled meters reviewed.
findings.recommendation: Centralise meter calibration records in a digital metering management system with automatic certificate renewal reminders.
findings.managementResponse: Digital metering records system deployed. All outstanding calibration certificates obtained.
findings.responsiblePerson: Head of Metering and Revenue Protection
findings.actionTaken: Digital calibration database implemented. All 340 outstanding certificates obtained and uploaded.

scope: Generation plant performance audit covering Kafue Gorge Upper, Kariba North Bank, and Victoria Falls stations - efficiency ratios, planned maintenance compliance and availability factors
executiveSummary: Performance audit identified below-target plant availability at Kariba North Bank due to maintenance backlogs, and non-compliance with planned maintenance schedules at Victoria Falls station.

findings.title: Kariba North Bank Plant Availability Below Target
findings.description: Kariba North Bank station achieved 68% plant availability factor against a target of 82%, resulting in an estimated ZMW 320,000,000 of lost generation revenue over the review period.
findings.recommendation: Accelerate World Bank-funded rehabilitation project. Implement predictive maintenance programme using condition monitoring sensors.
findings.managementResponse: Rehabilitation works accelerated. Condition monitoring system procurement initiated.
findings.actionTaken: Rehabilitation works advanced. Plant availability improved to 79% by October 2024. Condition monitoring system installed on 4 units.

findings.title: Victoria Falls Station Planned Maintenance Non-Compliance
findings.description: Only 61% of scheduled preventive maintenance tasks were completed on time at Victoria Falls station in the review period, increasing unplanned outage risk.
findings.recommendation: Implement computerised maintenance management system (CMMS) to schedule, track and escalate overdue maintenance tasks.
findings.managementResponse: CMMS deployed across all stations Q4 2023.
findings.actionTaken: CMMS (Maximo) deployed. Maintenance schedule compliance improved to 88% by February 2024.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit for FY 2022/23 including review of capital project expenditure and donor fund utilisation
executiveSummary: Unqualified audit opinion issued for ZESCO FY 2022/23 financial statements. Two low-severity findings relating to payables cut-off and petty cash controls.

findings.title: Accounts Payable Cut-off Errors
findings.description: Nine supplier invoices totalling ZMW 8,200,000 received before 30 June 2023 were posted to FY 2023/24, resulting in an understatement of FY 2022/23 liabilities.
findings.recommendation: Implement a formal month-end and year-end cut-off procedure with confirmation checklist signed off by the CFO.
findings.managementResponse: Year-end cut-off checklist implemented from July 2023.
findings.actionTaken: Cut-off procedure implemented. Prior period adjustment made in FY 2023/24 opening balances.

findings.title: Petty Cash Controls Weakness
findings.description: Four of seven petty cash imprest accounts were not subject to monthly independent reconciliation and two had unrecorded cash shortfalls totalling ZMW 45,000.
findings.recommendation: Require monthly independent petty cash reconciliation and surprise counts at all imprest locations.
findings.managementResponse: Monthly reconciliation policy enforced from August 2023.
findings.actionTaken: All shortfalls recovered. Monthly reconciliation and surprise count schedule implemented.

scope: Cybersecurity posture assessment including penetration testing, data centre physical security, disaster recovery readiness and staff security awareness
executiveSummary: Cybersecurity assessment revealed significant vulnerabilities in external-facing web applications and inadequate DR testing. Four findings raised including two high-severity. Immediate remediation of critical web vulnerabilities completed during the audit.

findings.title: Critical SQL Injection Vulnerability in Customer Portal
findings.description: Penetration testing identified a SQL injection vulnerability in the ZESCO self-service customer portal that could allow unauthorised access to 780,000 customer account records.
findings.recommendation: Immediate patching of identified vulnerability. Implement web application firewall and regular DAST scanning.
findings.managementResponse: Vulnerability patched within 72 hours of identification. WAF deployed.
findings.actionTaken: SQL injection vulnerability patched. Web application firewall deployed. DAST scanning scheduled quarterly.

findings.title: Disaster Recovery Plan Not Tested in 3 Years
findings.description: The IT Disaster Recovery Plan had not been subject to a live failover test since 2020, with no evidence of partial tests or tabletop exercises since that date. Recovery time objectives (RTOs) are unvalidated.
findings.recommendation: Conduct annual full DR failover test and quarterly tabletop exercises. Document results and update RTO/RPO targets based on test outcomes.
findings.managementResponse: DR test scheduled and completed Q3 2023. Annual DR test schedule established.
findings.actionTaken: Full DR failover test completed. RTO confirmed at 4 hours. Annual DR test calendar established.

findings.title: Data Centre Physical Access Log Gaps
findings.description: Data centre visitor access logs had gaps of 47 unlogged access events over a 6-month period, with no CCTV coverage of two server rack rows.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade to biometric access control with automated logging. Install CCTV to provide 100% server room coverage.
findings.managementResponse: Biometric access system and additional CCTV installed Q2 2023.
findings.actionTaken: Biometric access installed. CCTV extended to full coverage. Access log review process monthly.

findings.title: Staff Security Awareness Training Non-Compliance
findings.description: Only 34% of ZESCO staff had completed the mandatory annual cybersecurity awareness training, leaving 66% without basic phishing and social engineering education.
findings.recommendation: Mandate and track annual cybersecurity training completion. Include as a KPI in performance contracts for all line managers.
findings.managementResponse: Online training platform deployed. Training completion rate reached 91% by August 2023.
findings.actionTaken: Mandatory online training deployed. Completion rate 91%. Non-compliant staff escalated to line managers.

scope: Consolidated financial statement audit for IDC Group FY 2023/24 covering all 14 portfolio companies
executiveSummary: Unqualified consolidated audit opinion issued. Emphasis of matter paragraph included regarding going concern of Maamba Collieries. Two findings relating to goodwill impairment assessment and intercompany elimination procedures.

findings.title: Goodwill Impairment Assessment Methodology Inconsistency
findings.description: The discount rate used in the FY 2024 goodwill impairment model for three portfolio entities was not updated to reflect the prevailing 2024 Zambian interest rate environment (policy rate 13.5%), resulting in a potential ZMW 95,000,000 overstatement of goodwill.
findings.recommendation: Update impairment model discount rates to current Zambian market rates. Implement annual CFO sign-off on key model assumptions before external audit commencement.
findings.managementResponse: Goodwill restated in FY 2024 financial statements. Model update protocol established.
findings.actionTaken: Impairment model updated. Goodwill adjusted by ZMW 72,000,000. CFO sign-off process implemented.

findings.title: Intercompany Elimination Errors in Consolidation
findings.description: Three intercompany trading balances between IDC and subsidiary entities were not fully eliminated in the FY 2024 consolidation, overstating group revenue by ZMW 28,000,000.
findings.recommendation: Implement a consolidation checklist requiring subsidiary CFO confirmation of all intercompany balances before group consolidation is run.
findings.managementResponse: Intercompany confirmation process implemented. Consolidation pack updated.
findings.actionTaken: Revenue overstatement corrected. Intercompany confirmation pack implemented for all subsidiaries.

scope: Portfolio investment risk management audit covering due diligence practices, loan covenant monitoring, and investee company performance reporting
executiveSummary: Portfolio risk audit identified significant weaknesses in loan covenant monitoring and due diligence documentation for three recent investments. Three high and medium severity findings raised.

findings.title: Loan Covenant Monitoring Gaps
findings.description: For 5 of 12 IDC debt investments reviewed, covenant compliance certificates had not been received from investee companies for more than 2 quarters, with no escalation action taken by IDC portfolio managers.
findings.recommendation: Implement an automated covenant monitoring dashboard with email alerts and escalation to CIO when certificates are 30 days overdue.
findings.managementResponse: Covenant monitoring system under development. Manual tracking sheet implemented as interim measure.
findings.actionTaken: Interim manual tracking implemented. All 5 investees contacted and covenant certificates obtained. Automated system in development.

findings.title: Due Diligence Documentation Incomplete for Three New Investments
findings.description: Three investments made in FY 2024 totalling ZMW 680,000,000 lacked complete due diligence files. Missing items included environmental and social assessments, independent valuations, and management background checks.
findings.recommendation: Mandate investment committee sign-off checklist confirming completeness of all due diligence items before approval. Retrospectively obtain missing documentation for the three identified investments.
findings.managementResponse: Investment Policy updated. Missing documentation being obtained. IC checklist implemented from August 2024.
findings.actionTaken: Investment Committee checklist implemented. Retrospective documentation obtained for 2 of 3 investments. Third under progress.

findings.title: Investee Quarterly Reporting Compliance Below Target
findings.description: Only 58% of IDC portfolio companies submitted quarterly performance reports within the required 45-day deadline in FY 2024, reducing IDC portfolio oversight quality.
findings.recommendation: Include quarterly reporting compliance as a loan covenant or shareholder agreement condition. Introduce automatic late submission fees in new investment agreements.
findings.managementResponse: Reporting compliance clause added to all new investment agreements. Existing investees issued formal compliance notices.
findings.actionTaken: Compliance notices issued. Q3 2024 reporting compliance improved to 83%. New agreement templates updated.

scope: SOE performance audit commissioned by Ministry of Finance covering IDC KPI achievement, portfolio value creation, and development impact delivery for FY 2023
executiveSummary: Performance audit found IDC partially meeting SOE performance agreement targets. Financial KPIs achieved. Development impact targets for job creation and SME linkages below plan. Two medium-severity findings noted.

findings.title: Job Creation KPI Shortfall
findings.description: IDC reported 8,200 new jobs created against a target of 12,000 in the FY 2023 SOE Performance Agreement, a 32% shortfall. Key delays in Kafue Industrial Park Phase II and Agrifoods Hub explain most of the variance.
findings.recommendation: Revise quarterly job creation monitoring with project milestone linkage. Engage Ministry to revise target-setting methodology to reflect construction phase reality.
findings.managementResponse: Revised job creation tracking framework submitted to Ministry. KPIs to be renegotiated in FY 2025 Performance Agreement.
findings.actionTaken: Revised performance framework submitted. Ministry engagement ongoing on FY 2025 targets.

findings.title: SME Supplier Linkage Target Not Achieved
findings.description: IDC portfolio companies sourced only 18% of procurement from SMEs against a 30% target set in the SOE agreement, limiting local economic multiplier impact.
findings.recommendation: Implement IDC Group SME Procurement Policy with minimum SME spend thresholds enforced via board-level reporting.
findings.managementResponse: IDC SME Procurement Policy drafted and under Board review.
findings.actionTaken: SME Procurement Policy drafted. Procurement tracker developed for portfolio companies.

scope: SECZAM regulatory compliance inspection covering Securities Act obligations, board governance, related party disclosures, and financial reporting standards
executiveSummary: SECZAM inspection identified two compliance findings relating to board independence and related party transaction disclosures. Both findings communicated to the IDC Board with remediation required within 6 months.

findings.title: Board Independence Ratio Below Minimum Requirement
findings.description: IDC board had 3 independent non-executive directors of the required minimum of 5, with two vacancies open for more than 6 months in breach of SECZAM Governance Code requirements.
findings.recommendation: Urgently fill board vacancies to achieve minimum independent director composition. Report progress to SECZAM quarterly.
findings.managementResponse: Ministry of Finance shareholder appointment process initiated. Estimated completion Q1 2024.
findings.actionTaken: One independent director appointed Q2 2024. Second appointment still pending as at December 2024.

findings.title: Related Party Transaction Disclosures Incomplete
findings.description: Five related party transactions between IDC and investee companies totalling ZMW 145,000,000 were not disclosed in the FY 2022/23 financial statements as required by IAS 24.
findings.recommendation: Implement a related party transaction register maintained by the Company Secretary with mandatory annual disclosure review before audit sign-off.
findings.managementResponse: Related party register established. FY 2023/24 disclosures reviewed and confirmed complete.
findings.actionTaken: Related party register established. FY 2022/23 comparative disclosures restated. FY 2023/24 disclosures verified.

scope: Information systems audit covering ERP controls, data integrity, user access management, and IT general controls across IDC head office and three major subsidiaries
executiveSummary: IT audit identified significant weaknesses in ERP access controls and data backup procedures. Three findings raised with two high-severity. Immediate action taken to remediate critical access control weaknesses.

findings.title: Segregation of Duties Conflict in Finance ERP
findings.description: 14 finance ERP user accounts had conflicting roles allowing the same individual to both raise purchase orders and approve payment, creating an unmitigated fraud risk.
findings.recommendation: Redesign ERP role matrix to enforce segregation of duties. Implement compensating controls including supervisory review where SOD conflicts are unavoidable.
findings.managementResponse: ERP role redesign completed June 2023. All 14 conflicting accounts restructured.
findings.actionTaken: ERP roles restructured. SOD matrix documented and approved. Automated SOD conflict reports run monthly.

findings.title: Data Backup and Recovery Procedures Not Tested
findings.description: ERP and financial system data backups had not been subject to a recovery test in 18 months. Backup logs indicated 3 failed backup jobs not investigated in the prior quarter.
findings.recommendation: Implement monthly backup recovery tests and automated monitoring of backup job success with escalation for failures.
findings.managementResponse: Backup recovery test completed May 2023. Monthly test schedule established.
findings.actionTaken: Recovery test completed confirming RTO of 6 hours. Automated monitoring deployed. Monthly test schedule operational.

findings.title: Orphaned User Accounts in ERP System
findings.description: 68 user accounts in the ERP system belonged to former employees or contractors with no current engagement, some with active elevated privileges dating back to 2019.
findings.recommendation: Implement quarterly user access reviews with HR reconciliation to remove dormant and orphaned accounts.
findings.managementResponse: All 68 orphaned accounts disabled. Quarterly access review process implemented.
findings.actionTaken: 68 orphaned accounts disabled. HR-IT reconciliation process established. Q4 2023 review confirmed clean user register.

scope: Human resources and procurement audit covering recruitment practices, contract management, supplier vetting and procurement policy compliance across IDC and three portfolio entities
executiveSummary: Audit in progress. Fieldwork phase complete. Two preliminary findings identified relating to procurement threshold compliance and staff recruitment documentation. Management responses being prepared.

findings.title: Procurement Threshold Approvals Bypassed
findings.description: Preliminary finding: 7 procurement transactions between ZMW 500,000 and ZMW 2,000,000 were approved at Head of Department level, bypassing the required Board Tender Committee approval threshold.
findings.recommendation: Enforce procurement approval matrix. Implement system controls in ERP to route transactions above threshold automatically to Board Tender Committee queue.
findings.managementResponse: Under review. Management response to be submitted by 28 February 2025.

findings.title: Staff Recruitment Documentation Gaps
findings.description: Preliminary finding: 12 of 35 recruitment files reviewed were missing mandatory interview score sheets, reference check records or declaration of interest forms, creating compliance and litigation risk.
findings.recommendation: Implement electronic recruitment management system with mandatory completion checks for all documentation before appointment can be confirmed.
findings.managementResponse: Under review. Management response to be submitted by 28 February 2025.

scope: Consolidated financial statement audit for IDC Group FY 2022/23
executiveSummary: Unqualified consolidated audit opinion issued for IDC FY 2022/23. Two low-severity findings related to management accounts timeliness and subsidiary board minutes.

findings.title: Monthly Management Accounts Published Late
findings.description: In 9 of 12 months in FY 2022/23, IDC Group monthly management accounts were distributed to the Board more than 20 working days after month end, reducing the timeliness of Board financial oversight.
findings.recommendation: Set a firm 15-working-day management accounts publication deadline. Track compliance as a CFO KPI.
findings.managementResponse: 15-day deadline implemented. Compliance tracked monthly.
findings.actionTaken: Average publication time reduced to 12 working days. Compliance tracked. No late submissions since February 2024.

findings.title: Subsidiary Board Minutes Not Obtained for Consolidation File
findings.description: Board minutes for 4 of 14 subsidiaries were not included in the group consolidation file, limiting evidence of subsidiary-level approval of financial results.
findings.recommendation: Add subsidiary board minutes as a mandatory item in the group consolidation package checklist.
findings.managementResponse: Consolidation package checklist updated. All subsidiary minutes obtained for FY 2023/24.
findings.actionTaken: Checklist updated. All FY 2023/24 subsidiary board minutes obtained and filed in consolidation pack.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit FY 2023/24 including IFRS 9 ECL models, fair value of investments, and regulatory capital disclosures
executiveSummary: Unqualified audit opinion issued for ZANACO FY 2023/24. Three findings noted relating to ECL model governance, fee income accrual, and treasury investment classification. No material misstatements identified.

findings.title: ECL Model Governance Documentation Insufficient
findings.description: The FY 2024 IFRS 9 ECL model lacked a formal model validation report and the model governance framework was last updated in 2021, predating significant changes to the Zambian macroeconomic environment.
findings.recommendation: Establish an annual ECL model validation cycle with independent internal validation sign-off and external benchmarking every 3 years.
findings.managementResponse: ECL model validation policy approved by Board Risk Committee. Q1 2025 validation in progress.
findings.actionTaken: Model governance framework updated. Annual validation calendar established. Q1 2025 validation underway.

findings.title: Fee and Commission Income Accrual Errors
findings.description: Fee and commission income from 3 structured trade finance products was accrued on a straight-line basis rather than effective interest rate basis as required by IFRS 15, resulting in a ZMW 12,000,000 timing difference.
findings.recommendation: Update fee recognition policies for complex structured products and implement IFRS 15 five-step model review in product approval process.
findings.managementResponse: Fee recognition policy updated. Income restated in FY 2024 financial statements.
findings.actionTaken: Income restated by ZMW 12,000,000. Policy updated. Product approval checklist updated with IFRS 15 sign-off requirement.

findings.title: Treasury Investment Classification Inconsistency
findings.description: ZMW 250,000,000 of government securities were classified as held-to-maturity but had been disposed of before maturity in two instances, potentially triggering IFRS 9 reclassification requirements for the entire HTM portfolio.
findings.recommendation: Review all disposals before maturity against IFRS 9 HTM tainting rules. Establish treasury dealing committee sign-off for any early disposal of HTM instruments.
findings.managementResponse: Legal opinion obtained confirming tainting threshold not breached. Treasury dealing policy updated.
findings.actionTaken: IFRS 9 tainting analysis completed. Portfolio reclassification not required. Dealing policy updated.

scope: BoZ full-scope prudential examination covering credit risk management, liquidity, capital adequacy, AML/CFT controls, and governance
executiveSummary: BoZ examination identified three findings across credit risk grading, liquidity stress testing, and AML transaction monitoring systems. Bank directed to implement remediation within 6 months.

findings.title: Credit Risk Grading Model Inaccuracy
findings.description: BoZ examination found that 8% of the commercial loan portfolio had been graded one rating above the objectively assessed grade based on loan performance data, potentially understating required provisions by ZMW 85,000,000.
findings.recommendation: Recalibrate credit risk grading model. Implement quarterly independent model validation. Immediately re-grade flagged commercial exposures.
findings.managementResponse: Re-grading exercise completed. Provision top-up of ZMW 62,000,000 recognised in Q3 2024 accounts.
findings.actionTaken: Portfolio re-graded. ZMW 62,000,000 additional provision raised. Model validation framework established.

findings.title: Liquidity Stress Test Scenarios Insufficient
findings.description: ZANACO liquidity stress testing framework used only one scenario (mild shock) rather than the BoZ-required minimum of three scenarios (mild, moderate, and severe), limiting the adequacy of liquidity risk management.
findings.recommendation: Update LCR/NSFR stress testing framework to incorporate three scenarios as required by BoZ guidelines. Run monthly and report to ALCO.
findings.managementResponse: Three-scenario stress testing framework implemented and presented to ALCO in August 2024.
findings.actionTaken: Stress testing framework updated. Three scenarios run monthly. ALCO liquidity risk report redesigned.

findings.title: AML Transaction Monitoring System Alert Backlog
findings.description: As at the examination date, the ZANACO AML transaction monitoring system had 4,200 unreviewed alerts older than 30 days, indicating insufficient analyst capacity relative to alert volume.
findings.recommendation: Increase AML analyst headcount or implement AI-based alert triage to reduce alert backlog. Set maximum 10-day alert review SLA.
findings.managementResponse: 6 additional AML analysts recruited. Alert triage tool procurement in progress.
findings.actionTaken: 6 analysts recruited and onboarded. Backlog cleared to 800 alerts. AI triage tool procurement at tender stage.

scope: Credit risk management audit covering origination controls, collateral management, watch-list monitoring, and SME portfolio quality
executiveSummary: Credit risk audit found generally adequate controls. Two medium-severity findings relating to collateral revaluation frequency and watchlist review timeliness.

findings.title: Collateral Revaluation Overdue for Large Exposures
findings.description: 18 commercial loans with exposure above ZMW 10,000,000 had not had their collateral independently revalued in more than 3 years, against a policy requirement of annual revaluation for large exposures.
findings.recommendation: Establish a collateral revaluation calendar managed by the Credit Operations team. Generate automated reminders 60 days before revaluation due dates.
findings.managementResponse: Revaluation calendar established. All 18 overdue collaterals revalued by June 2024.
findings.actionTaken: All 18 collaterals revalued. Automated calendar system implemented. Revaluation compliance now at 97%.

findings.title: Watchlist Review Meeting Frequency Non-Compliance
findings.description: Credit watchlist review meetings were held quarterly rather than monthly as required by ZANACO credit policy for non-performing and sub-standard loans above ZMW 5,000,000.
findings.recommendation: Reinstate monthly watchlist review meetings. Ensure all sub-standard and doubtful exposures above ZMW 5,000,000 are tabled monthly.
findings.managementResponse: Monthly watchlist meetings reinstated from March 2024. Minutes and attendance records maintained.
findings.actionTaken: Monthly watchlist meetings reinstated. 10 months of consecutive meetings held. NPL ratio improved to 6.2% by September 2024.

scope: AML/CFT compliance examination covering customer due diligence, beneficial ownership identification, STR reporting, and sanctions screening
executiveSummary: FIC inspection identified systemic weaknesses in correspondent banking due diligence and STR reporting timeliness. Three findings raised, one high-severity. Financial penalty of ZMW 1,500,000 levied. Remediation plan accepted.

findings.title: Correspondent Banking Due Diligence Deficiencies
findings.description: Correspondent banking relationships with 4 financial institutions in high-risk jurisdictions lacked current due diligence files, risk assessments, or annual review documentation, breaching FIC Act requirements.
findings.recommendation: Conduct immediate due diligence refresh on all correspondent relationships. Implement a correspondent banking policy with annual review cycle and risk-based enhanced due diligence for high-risk correspondents.
findings.managementResponse: Correspondent banking policy approved. Due diligence refresh initiated. One high-risk relationship terminated.
findings.actionTaken: Correspondent banking policy implemented. 3 of 4 due diligence files completed. One relationship terminated. Annual review cycle established.

findings.title: Suspicious Transaction Report Filing Delays
findings.description: Analysis of STR filing records showed that 34% of STRs were filed with FIC more than 5 days after the triggering event was identified internally, exceeding the 24-hour statutory requirement.
findings.recommendation: Implement a timed STR workflow in the AML system with mandatory escalation if not filed within 12 hours. Conduct root cause analysis of delayed filings.
findings.managementResponse: STR workflow updated. Training conducted. Average STR filing time reduced to 18 hours.
findings.actionTaken: AML system workflow redesigned. 3-month post-remediation data shows 92% STRs filed within 24 hours.

findings.title: Beneficial Ownership Data Incomplete for Corporate Clients
findings.description: 26% of corporate customer profiles lacked verified beneficial ownership information to the natural person level as required by the FIC (Amendment) Act No. 15 of 2016.
findings.recommendation: Initiate beneficial ownership refresh programme for all corporate clients. Block account activity for high-risk segments until beneficial ownership is confirmed.
findings.managementResponse: Beneficial ownership campaign completed. 94% of corporate profiles updated by March 2024.
findings.actionTaken: Beneficial ownership refresh campaign completed. 94% of corporate profiles updated. Remaining 6% in dormant/inactive category under review.

scope: Core banking T24 system security audit and IT general controls review following migration, covering access controls, change management, data integrity, and interface security
executiveSummary: Post-migration IT audit identified four findings across access control, change management, data reconciliation and third-party interface controls. Two high-severity findings remediated within 60 days of report issuance.

findings.title: Superuser Accounts Not Restricted Post-Migration
findings.description: 14 T24 superuser accounts created during core banking migration retained unrestricted system access 4 months after go-live, posing a significant fraud and data integrity risk.
findings.recommendation: Immediately restrict or disable all migration superuser accounts. Implement permanent superuser access management policy with dual-control and time-limited access.
findings.managementResponse: All 14 superuser accounts disabled within 48 hours of finding. Permanent policy implemented.
findings.actionTaken: All 14 superuser accounts disabled immediately. Dual-control superuser policy implemented. Monthly superuser account review established.

findings.title: Change Management Process Bypassed for 8 Production Patches
findings.description: 8 emergency patches applied to the T24 production environment did not go through the formal change management process including impact assessment, testing, and change advisory board approval.
findings.recommendation: Enforce no-exception change management process for all production changes. Implement emergency change procedure with post-implementation review within 5 days.
findings.managementResponse: Change management policy updated. Emergency change procedure documented and enforced.
findings.actionTaken: Change advisory board reconstituted. Emergency change procedure implemented. 100% of changes since August 2023 processed through approved channels.

findings.title: T24 to General Ledger Reconciliation Gaps
findings.description: Daily automated reconciliation between T24 core banking and the general ledger was not running for 3 subsidiary GL account codes, resulting in ZMW 4,300,000 of unreconciled items accumulating over 90 days.
findings.recommendation: Fix T24-GL reconciliation configuration for all account codes. Implement daily automated reconciliation exception report reviewed by Head of Finance.
findings.managementResponse: T24-GL reconciliation fixed. All unreconciled items cleared. Daily exception report implemented.
findings.actionTaken: Reconciliation configuration corrected. ZMW 4,300,000 unreconciled items cleared. Daily exception report operational since August 2023.

findings.title: Third-Party API Interface Security Inadequate
findings.description: Three fintech API integrations with T24 lacked mutual TLS authentication and transmitted customer transaction data over non-encrypted channels in 2 out of 3 cases.
findings.recommendation: Mandate mutual TLS and data-in-transit encryption for all T24 API integrations. Conduct API security review before new integration go-live.
findings.managementResponse: All 3 interfaces re-engineered with mutual TLS by June 2023.
findings.actionTaken: Mutual TLS implemented on all 3 APIs. API security standard documented. New integration approval checklist includes encryption requirement.

scope: Branch network performance audit covering customer service standards, cash management, teller error rates, and branch profitability across 20 sampled branches
executiveSummary: Audit in progress. Two preliminary findings identified relating to cash variance management and branch KPI reporting accuracy. Draft report under management review.

findings.title: Cash Variance Write-off Approvals Irregular
findings.description: Preliminary finding: Cash shortfalls totalling ZMW 180,000 across 6 branches were written off without the required area manager approval, with local branch manager self-authorisation used in each case.
findings.recommendation: Enforce approval matrix for cash variance write-offs. Implement daily cash variance reporting to area managers for exceptions above ZMW 5,000.
findings.managementResponse: Under review. Management response to be submitted by 15 March 2025.

findings.title: Branch KPI Reporting Data Inaccuracies
findings.description: Preliminary finding: 4 branches inflated reported new account opening numbers by including dormant account reactivations, overstating performance against targets by an estimated 15-22%.
findings.recommendation: Standardise KPI definitions in the branch reporting manual. Implement system-generated KPI extraction rather than manual branch reporting.
findings.managementResponse: Under review. Management response to be submitted by 15 March 2025.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit FY 2022/23
executiveSummary: Unqualified audit opinion issued for ZANACO FY 2022/23 financial statements. Two low-severity findings relating to corporate tax computation and operational lease accounting.

findings.title: Corporate Tax Computation Adjustment Required
findings.description: Tax depreciation on ZMW 95,000,000 of newly acquired computer equipment was claimed at 25% rather than the ZRA-prescribed 50% first-year allowance, resulting in a ZMW 11,875,000 overpayment of provisional tax.
findings.recommendation: Review ZRA capital allowance rates for all asset categories annually and apply correct rates in tax computation. Claim overpaid provisional tax as credit in next assessment.
findings.managementResponse: Tax overpayment credited in FY 2023 final assessment. ZRA capital allowance schedule reviewed and corrected.
findings.actionTaken: ZMW 11,875,000 tax credit applied in FY 2023 assessment. Asset register updated with correct ZRA allowance rates.

findings.title: IFRS 16 Operating Lease Liability Calculation Error
findings.description: IFRS 16 lease liabilities for 12 branch property leases were calculated using incorrect discount rates, resulting in a ZMW 7,200,000 understatement of lease liabilities on the balance sheet.
findings.recommendation: Recalculate all IFRS 16 lease liabilities using the incremental borrowing rate updated annually. Engage external valuers to verify discount rates.
findings.managementResponse: Lease liabilities recalculated. Balance sheet adjusted in FY 2022/23 financial statements.
findings.actionTaken: Lease liabilities restated. Incremental borrowing rate policy updated. Annual IFRS 16 discount rate review established.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit FY 2023/24 including capital project expenditure, donor fund utilisation, and going concern assessment
executiveSummary: Qualified audit opinion issued for Zambia Railways FY 2023/24 due to limitation of scope on the fixed asset register. Three findings relating to revenue recognition, going concern disclosures, and asset register completeness. Going concern emphasis of matter included in opinion.

findings.title: Incomplete Fixed Asset Register - Qualified Opinion Basis
findings.description: Zambia Railways could not provide complete and auditable fixed asset records for infrastructure assets (track, bridges, level crossings) covering approximately ZMW 2,800,000,000 of estimated value. This limitation resulted in a qualified audit opinion.
findings.recommendation: Commission a full infrastructure asset valuation and register exercise with a specialist infrastructure asset valuer. Target completion before FY 2024/25 audit.
findings.managementResponse: Infrastructure asset valuation project scoped. Tender issued Q1 2025.
findings.actionTaken: Specialist infrastructure asset valuer tender issued November 2024. Contract award expected Q2 2025. Interim asset register in development.

findings.title: Going Concern Disclosure Inadequate
findings.description: FY 2023/24 financial statements did not adequately disclose the material uncertainties affecting Zambia Railways as a going concern, including ZMW 850,000,000 of government-guaranteed debt maturing within 12 months and an accumulated deficit of ZMW 1,200,000,000.
findings.recommendation: Enhance going concern disclosures in the financial statements to include specific descriptions of mitigating actions and government support commitments.
findings.managementResponse: Going concern disclosure expanded in final financial statements with Ministry of Finance letter of support included as an appendix.
findings.actionTaken: Going concern disclosure substantially rewritten. Ministry of Finance commitment letter obtained and appended to financial statements.

findings.title: Freight Revenue Recognition Timing
findings.description: Freight revenue of ZMW 38,000,000 was recognised on contract signing rather than on delivery of freight services, contrary to IFRS 15 requirements. Affects Q1 and Q2 2024.
findings.recommendation: Update revenue recognition policy to apply IFRS 15 performance obligation-based recognition. Implement system control to prevent premature revenue posting.
findings.managementResponse: Revenue recognition policy updated. FY 2024 comparative restated. ERP control implemented.
findings.actionTaken: Revenue restated in FY 2024 financial statements. ERP revenue posting control updated. Policy document issued.

scope: Annual railway safety compliance audit covering SMS implementation, track geometry, rolling stock roadworthiness, level crossing safety, and driver licensing
executiveSummary: Safety audit found Zambia Railways partially compliant with RTSA safety standards. Three findings raised including operation of unlicensed locomotives and track geometry defects on the TAZARA corridor. Remediation notices issued.

findings.title: Operation of Unlicensed Locomotives in Revenue Service
findings.description: RTSA inspection confirmed that 16 locomotives in active freight revenue service did not hold current RTSA roadworthiness certificates, creating an unmitigated safety and regulatory risk.
findings.recommendation: Immediately withdraw all unlicensed locomotives from revenue service pending certification. Establish a rolling stock certification maintenance calendar.
findings.managementResponse: 14 of 16 locomotives withdrawn from service. 2 retained for emergency use under RTSA dispensation.
findings.actionTaken: 14 locomotives removed from revenue service. 8 passed re-certification. 6 under overhaul. Certification calendar implemented.

findings.title: Track Geometry Defects on Nakonde-Mpika Section
findings.description: RTSA geometry car inspection identified 23 track defects on the 180km Nakonde-Mpika section including rail gauge deviations and cross-level defects exceeding Category 3 limits, requiring speed restriction.
findings.recommendation: Impose immediate 40km/h speed restriction on affected sections. Complete tamping and lining works within 6 months.
findings.managementResponse: Speed restriction imposed immediately. Track maintenance team deployed. 12 of 23 defects remediated by December 2024.
findings.actionTaken: 40km/h speed restriction in force. 12 defects remediated. Remaining 11 scheduled for Q2 2025.

findings.title: Level Crossing Safety Signage Deficiencies
findings.description: 27 of 84 level crossings inspected lacked adequate warning signs, road surface markings, or functional approach warning systems, increasing road-rail collision risk.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade all deficient level crossings to RTSA standard within 3 months. Implement annual level crossing inspection programme.
findings.managementResponse: All 27 level crossings upgraded by September 2024.
findings.actionTaken: All 27 level crossings upgraded with new signage, road markings, and warning systems. RTSA re-inspection confirmed compliance.

scope: Environmental compliance audit of Zambia Railways depots, workshops, and right-of-way covering waste management, chemical storage, dust pollution, and emissions
executiveSummary: ZEMA inspection identified two high-severity findings relating to waste oil management and chemical storage at the Kabwe and Livingstone maintenance depots. Financial penalty of ZMW 750,000 levied. Remediation directive issued.

findings.title: Waste Oil Storage and Disposal Non-Compliance
findings.description: ZEMA inspection found inadequate waste oil containment at both Kabwe and Livingstone depots. Approximately 8,000 litres of waste diesel and transformer oil stored in unsealed drums with no secondary containment, in breach of the Hazardous Waste Management Regulations.
findings.recommendation: Install ZEMA-compliant bunded waste oil storage facilities at both depots. Contract a licensed hazardous waste disposal company for regular oil collection.
findings.managementResponse: Bunded storage facilities installed at Kabwe December 2024. Livingstone Q1 2025. Licensed disposal contract awarded.
findings.responsiblePerson: Head of Health, Safety and Environment
findings.actionTaken: Kabwe bunded storage installed and commissioned. Licensed disposal contractor appointed. Livingstone installation in progress.

findings.title: Chemical Storage Register Absent at All Depots
findings.description: Neither Kabwe nor Livingstone depots maintained the ZEMA-required chemical storage register documenting all hazardous substances, quantities, safety data sheets, and emergency response procedures.
findings.recommendation: Establish chemical storage register for each depot. Conduct staff training on hazardous substance handling. Post chemical safety notices at all storage points.
findings.managementResponse: Chemical registers established at all depots. Staff training completed August 2024.
findings.responsiblePerson: Head of Health, Safety and Environment
findings.actionTaken: Chemical registers established at all 6 depots. Safety data sheets filed. Staff training completed for 380 workshop employees.

scope: Procurement and contract management audit covering tender procedures, supplier vetting, contract compliance and change order management
executiveSummary: Procurement audit identified three findings across tender committee compliance, supplier vetting and change order controls. Findings indicate weak procurement governance with remediation required before major capital project procurements commence.

findings.title: Tender Committee Quorum Not Met for Six Contracts
findings.description: Six contracts with a combined value of ZMW 420,000,000 were approved at Tender Committee meetings that did not achieve the required quorum of 5 of 7 members, raising questions about the legality of the awards.
findings.recommendation: Require legal sign-off confirming quorum before contract award. Retrospectively review and ratify the 6 affected contracts through a properly constituted committee.
findings.managementResponse: All 6 contracts ratified by a properly constituted Tender Committee in February 2024. Committee attendance policy strengthened.
findings.actionTaken: All 6 contracts ratified. New Tender Committee standing orders require quorum verification before agenda commencement.

findings.title: Supplier Vetting Process Inadequate
findings.description: 3 suppliers awarded contracts totalling ZMW 85,000,000 had not been subject to the required financial and integrity vetting. One supplier had a ZRA tax default on record at the time of award.
findings.recommendation: Implement mandatory pre-award supplier vetting including ZRA tax clearance, PACRA company search, and debarment list check for all contracts above ZMW 5,000,000.
findings.managementResponse: Supplier vetting checklist implemented. Affected contracts reviewed.
findings.actionTaken: Mandatory vetting checklist implemented for all contracts above ZMW 5,000,000. Existing supplier register verified against ZRA debarment list.

findings.title: Change Orders Exceeding Policy Threshold Without Board Approval
findings.description: Approved change orders on 4 major infrastructure contracts had cumulatively increased contract values by an average of 38% above the original awarded amount without re-tendering or Board approval as required by ZR procurement policy for variations above 15%.
findings.recommendation: Enforce mandatory Board approval for cumulative contract variations above 15%. Implement change order tracking dashboard for all major contracts.
findings.managementResponse: Board approval obtained retrospectively for 3 of 4 contracts. One contract under review. Change order policy re-issued.
findings.actionTaken: Retrospective Board approval obtained for 3 contracts. Change order tracking register implemented. Policy re-issued to all contract managers.

scope: Freight operations performance audit covering freight volume targets, locomotive utilisation, wagon turnaround times, and revenue per tonne-km benchmarking
executiveSummary: Performance audit found Zambia Railways operating significantly below freight volume targets with poor locomotive availability and long wagon turnaround times. Two medium-severity findings. Structural operational improvements recommended.

findings.title: Freight Volume 34% Below Annual Target
findings.description: Zambia Railways carried 1,320,000 tonnes of freight in FY 2022/23 against a target of 2,000,000 tonnes, a 34% shortfall. Primary drivers were locomotive unavailability (average 42% serviceable), track speed restrictions, and customer migration to road transport.
findings.recommendation: Implement locomotive fleet renewal programme. Negotiate minimum volume commitments with Copperbelt mining customers. Develop freight growth strategy with competitive pricing model.
findings.managementResponse: Fleet renewal programme approved and financed. Copperbelt corridor customer agreements signed. Pricing model revised.
findings.actionTaken: Fleet renewal in progress. Mining customer MOU signed committing 1,800,000 tonnes per annum. New pricing tariff published January 2024.

findings.title: Wagon Turnaround Time Exceeds Regional Benchmarks
findings.description: Average wagon turnaround time of 18 days on the Copperbelt corridor compares unfavourably to SARA benchmark of 10 days, reducing effective wagon capacity and deterring large shippers.
findings.recommendation: Implement wagon tracking system. Introduce demurrage charges for excessive customer loading/unloading delays. Increase shunting capacity at Ndola yard.
findings.managementResponse: GPS wagon tracking system procured. Demurrage tariff approved by Board. Ndola yard shunting plan under review.
findings.actionTaken: GPS wagon tracking deployed on 320 wagons. Demurrage tariff implemented. Average turnaround time improved to 14 days.

scope: ICT infrastructure audit covering network security, ERP controls, GPS tracking systems, communications systems and IT disaster recovery
executiveSummary: Audit in progress. Two preliminary findings identified relating to ERP access controls and network security gaps at remote stations. Draft report being prepared.

findings.title: ERP Financial Module Segregation of Duties Conflict
findings.description: Preliminary finding: 9 ERP user accounts in the finance module have excessive permissions allowing both journal entry creation and posting approval without segregation of duties, presenting an unmitigated fraud risk.
findings.recommendation: Redesign ERP finance module role matrix to enforce segregation of duties between journal entry and approval functions.
findings.managementResponse: Under review. Management response to be submitted by 15 March 2025.

findings.title: Remote Station Network Connections Unencrypted
findings.description: Preliminary finding: Network links between ZR headquarters and 5 remote stations use unencrypted protocols, exposing operational communications and financial transaction data to interception risk.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade all remote station WAN links to VPN or encrypted MPLS connections. Implement network monitoring to detect unencrypted data transmission.
findings.managementResponse: Under review. Management response to be submitted by 15 March 2025.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit FY 2022/23
executiveSummary: Qualified audit opinion issued for ZR FY 2022/23 due to scope limitation on infrastructure asset values. Two findings relating to staff costs accrual and capital project cost classification.

findings.title: Staff Costs Year-End Accrual Understated
findings.description: Accruals for outstanding leave pay, gratuities, and year-end bonuses were understated by ZMW 22,000,000 in the FY 2022/23 financial statements, resulting in an overstatement of net profit.
findings.recommendation: Implement HR-Finance integrated leave management and staff liability accrual process with monthly reconciliation of all long-term staff liabilities.
findings.managementResponse: Staff liability accrual model rebuilt with HR input. FY 2022/23 comparatives restated.
findings.actionTaken: Staff liability model updated. ZMW 22,000,000 restated in comparatives. Monthly HR-Finance reconciliation established.

findings.title: Capital Project Costs Incorrectly Expensed
findings.description: ZMW 15,500,000 of expenditure on track rehabilitation works qualifying as capital improvement was expensed to the income statement rather than capitalised to fixed assets, understating both assets and net profit.
findings.recommendation: Implement a capital project cost classification policy with engineering sign-off distinguishing maintenance from capital improvement expenditure for all track and infrastructure works.
findings.managementResponse: Capital vs maintenance cost classification policy issued. FY 2022/23 comparatives restated.
findings.actionTaken: Policy issued. ZMW 15,500,000 capitalised in comparative restatement. Engineering sign-off form implemented for all infrastructure project spend.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit for the year ended 31 December 2024 including portfolio investment valuations, mine rehabilitation provision, and dividend income recognition
executiveSummary: Unqualified audit opinion issued for ZCCM-IH FY2024. Financial statements present a true and fair view. Two observations raised regarding mine rehabilitation provision disclosure granularity and intercompany dividend accrual timing.

findings.title: Mine Rehabilitation Provision — Insufficient Segment Disclosure
findings.description: FY2024 financial statements disclose the aggregate mine rehabilitation provision of ZMW 3,800,000,000 but do not provide segment-level disclosure by mine site as recommended by IFRIC 1 and emerging ISSB sustainability standards.
findings.recommendation: Enhance mine rehabilitation provision note to include mine-by-mine breakdown of provision balances, key assumptions, and discount rates applied.
findings.managementResponse: Agreed. Mine-by-mine disclosure added to note 18 of the FY2024 financial statements before final publication.
findings.actionTaken: Note 18 enhanced with Kansanshi, Lumwana, Chibuluma, Luanshya, and Baluba site-level provision disclosures.

findings.title: Kansanshi Dividend Accrual — Timing Difference
findings.description: ZCCM-IH accrued ZMW 145,000,000 of Kansanshi Q4 2024 dividends as at 31 December 2024 based on management estimates. The actual Q4 dividend was declared by Kansanshi Mining PLC board on 10 January 2025. Under IFRS 9, dividend income should be recognised only when the right to receive payment is established.
findings.recommendation: Align dividend income recognition policy with IFRS 9 — recognise dividend income only upon formal declaration by the investee company board.
findings.managementResponse: Agreed. Accounting policy updated. FY2024 Q4 Kansanshi dividend of ZMW 145,000,000 derecognised as at 31 December 2024 and recognised in January 2025.
findings.actionTaken: Dividend recognition policy updated. ZMW 145,000,000 removed from FY2024 and recognised in FY2025 Q1.

scope: IT general controls and cybersecurity review covering financial reporting systems, investment management platform, treasury management system, and network security. Assessment against COBIT 2019 and ISO 27001 frameworks.
executiveSummary: IT security audit identified 12 findings of which 2 are rated High. High findings relate to privileged access management in the treasury management system and outdated patch management on financial reporting servers.

findings.title: Privileged Access Management — Treasury System
findings.description: The treasury management system has 14 active user accounts with System Administrator privileges, of which 6 belong to former employees or contractors whose access was not revoked upon departure. This represents a material cybersecurity and fraud risk for the treasury and dividend disbursement function.
findings.recommendation: Immediately revoke all system administrator access for departed staff. Implement quarterly user access review process. Require dual authorisation for all treasury payments above ZMW 500,000.
findings.managementResponse: Six accounts revoked within 48 hours of audit notification. Quarterly user access review process established. Dual authorisation controls implemented.
findings.actionTaken: Six accounts revoked. User access quarterly review established. Dual-auth implemented in TMS.

findings.title: Financial Reporting Servers — Patch Management Backlog
findings.description: Three of the five financial reporting servers are running operating system versions with 87 outstanding critical security patches, the oldest dating back 18 months. This creates vulnerability to ransomware and data breach, which could compromise financial reporting integrity and LuSE/AIM continuous disclosure obligations.
findings.recommendation: Implement a structured patch management programme with critical patches applied within 30 days of release. Consider engaging a managed security service provider.
findings.managementResponse: Emergency patching programme initiated. Critical patches applied to 2 of 3 servers by November 2024. Third server requires scheduled maintenance window in January 2025.
findings.actionTaken: 2/3 servers patched. Third server patching scheduled January 2025. MSSP RFP in progress.

scope: Independent review of the adequacy of ZCCM-IH mine rehabilitation liability provisions across portfolio mining operations, including acid mine drainage cost estimates, tailings facility closure costs, and long-term environmental monitoring obligations for Kansanshi, Lumwana, Chibuluma, Luanshya, and Baluba.
executiveSummary: Review in progress. Preliminary findings indicate that acid mine drainage remediation costs at the former Luanshya Mine site may be underestimated by 12-18% based on updated hydrogeological modelling. Full report expected February 2025.

findings.title: Luanshya AMD Remediation Cost Underestimation — Preliminary Finding
findings.description: Preliminary hydrogeological modelling indicates that acid mine drainage at the former Luanshya Mine is migrating further than previously modelled. Current cost estimate of ZMW 480,000,000 for AMD remediation may understate actual costs by 12-18%, suggesting additional provision of ZMW 58-86 million may be required.
findings.recommendation: Commission updated hydrogeological survey to define AMD migration extent; revise AMD remediation cost estimate before FY2024 accounts are finalised; increase provision if updated estimate confirms shortfall.
findings.managementResponse: Updated hydrogeological survey commissioned. CFO to hold ZMW 70,000,000 contingent provision pending final SRK report.
findings.actionTaken: Updated survey underway. Contingent provision of ZMW 70M held by CFO pending final report.

findings.title: Baluba Mine Tailings Facility — Closure Cost Not Updated Since 2019
findings.description: The Baluba Mine tailings facility closure cost estimate has not been updated since 2019. SRK recommends a full engineering-based cost review given inflation in civil construction, liner materials, and water treatment costs since 2019. Preliminary estimate suggests costs may have increased by 25-35%.
findings.recommendation: Commission a full engineering-based closure cost estimate for the Baluba tailings facility by Q1 2025 and update the FY2024 rehabilitation provision accordingly.
findings.managementResponse: Engineering cost review for Baluba TSF included in SRK scope of work. Updated estimate expected in full report February 2025.
findings.actionTaken: Baluba TSF closure cost review included in SRK scope. Awaiting full report.

scope: Full-year financial statement audit for FY2024 including gold procurement and sales, refinery operations, artisanal mining formalisation programme, and cash management controls
executiveSummary: FY2024 external audit in progress. Preliminary fieldwork completed with two audit findings identified relating to gold inventory reconciliation and procurement contract documentation. Final opinion anticipated by 30 April 2025.

findings.title: Gold Inventory Reconciliation Controls
findings.description: Monthly gold inventory reconciliation between buying centres, transit, and refinery inputs is performed manually on spreadsheets, creating risk of undetected errors. Auditors noted two instances of reconciling items exceeding ZMW 2,500,000 that took over 15 days to resolve in H1 2024.
findings.recommendation: Implement a dedicated gold inventory management system with automated reconciliation, real-time stock tracking from buying centres to refinery output, and tolerance-based exception alerts.
findings.managementResponse: Management agrees with finding. ERP module for inventory management has been scoped and is included in the FY2025 IT capital budget of ZMW 18,000,000. Target go-live Q3 2025.
findings.actionTaken: Manual reconciliation improved with additional daily verification step. ERP procurement process initiated.

findings.title: Procurement Contract Documentation Gaps
findings.description: 8 of 45 artisanal mining group procurement contracts sampled did not have signed copies in the contract management register. Unsigned or missing contracts expose the company to disputes over gold payment terms and quantity commitments.
findings.recommendation: Implement a centralised contract management register with mandatory document completeness checks before procurement payments are processed. Conduct periodic contract file reviews.
findings.managementResponse: All 8 missing contracts have been obtained and filed. Contract completeness check incorporated into procurement payment approval workflow.
findings.responsiblePerson: Head of Legal and Regulatory Affairs
findings.actionTaken: Missing contracts obtained and filed. Payment approval checklist updated. Contract register audit completed.

scope: Review of gold buying centre operations across all 12 centres: procurement controls, cash handling, weighing and assay procedures, and compliance with Anti-Money Laundering regulations
executiveSummary: Internal audit of gold buying centre operations identified two medium-severity findings relating to AML identification procedures and weighing scale calibration. Overall controls at buying centres rated satisfactory. No instances of procurement fraud identified.

findings.title: Anti-Money Laundering — Miner Identification Gaps
findings.description: At 3 of 12 buying centres, miners' National Registration Cards (NRCs) were not consistently photocopied and retained for transactions above ZMW 50,000. This creates non-compliance with the Financial Intelligence Centre Act requirements for customer due diligence records.
findings.recommendation: Implement mandatory NRC photocopying for all gold transactions and maintain records for minimum 5 years as required by the Financial Intelligence Centre Act. Retrain all buying centre staff on AML procedures.
findings.managementResponse: AML retraining conducted at all 12 buying centres in October 2024. NRC photocopying made mandatory in transaction processing checklist. Centre managers held accountable for compliance.
findings.actionTaken: All buying centre staff retrained. Mandatory NRC check implemented in transaction processing system. No repeat occurrences noted in November follow-up visit.

findings.title: Weighing Scale Calibration Records Incomplete
findings.description: Calibration certificates for 4 of 36 gold weighing scales across buying centres had expired by more than 3 months. Uncalibrated scales could result in incorrect gold weights and overpayment to miners.
findings.recommendation: Establish a centralised calibration schedule with mandatory quarterly calibration of all gold weighing equipment by a ZABS-accredited laboratory. Implement a register of calibration due dates with automated reminders to centre managers.
findings.managementResponse: All 36 scales recalibrated in September 2024. Centralised calibration schedule implemented. Automated email reminders set up 30 days before calibration due date.
findings.actionTaken: All scales recalibrated by ZABS-accredited laboratory. Centralised schedule and automated reminders operational.
